channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Speeding The Decoupling Of GDP Growth And Emissions With AI
item.description: To borrow from Marc Andreesen, technology is eating traditional industry, and we’re finding new avenues for progress and growth without using up the planet’s resources.

item.title: Mediocrity and perfectionism
item.description: It’s surprising to realize that they’re the same. They are both places to hide. When we ship average work, it’s not our fault. We’re simply doing what the manual says, and if you don’t like it, blame the culture and the system. And when we hold back on shipping because it isn’t perfect, we’re also […]

item.title: Etsy Promised To End Sales Of Porn And Sex Toys. It's Not Going Well.
item.description: Etsy is still teeming with thousands of listings that blatantly violate its new policy, two weeks after it was enacted.

item.title: Fire inspectors
item.description: Running into a burning building is heroic work. Keeping buildings from burning down in the first place is actually just as important. And it scales more reliably.

item.title: How Big Banks Are Gunning For Buy-Now, Pay-Later Fintechs
item.description: Like the Millennials and Gen Zers it caters to, the BNPL business is facing adult challenges–in the industry’s case, regulation and competition.

item.title: Living in the future
item.description: In a bad 1950s science fiction movie, you might see flying jetpacks, invisibility cloaks and ray guns. What we got instead is a device that fits in our pocket. It allows us to connect to more than a billion people. It knows where we are and where we’re going. It has all of our contacts, […]

item.title: Cloud Systems Are Under Fire, And The C-Suite Must Take Action
item.description: ERP software requires extensive adaptation with custom codes and applications to foster secure development life cycles and avoid technical debt.

item.title: Adjacent but not relevant
item.description: There’s a sale on band saw blades, including a really good deal on one that fits the saw you owned years ago. The folks who live next door to the house you used to live in are having a raucous party. A guy with a name just like yours wins the lottery… These adjacencies can […]

item.title: Supercharging The Developer Experience With AI
item.description: It is one thing to ask your teams to improve their productivity with AI, but it's another to be intentional about it.

item.title: Silence vs noise
item.description: When a group comes together, noise is easy. Just a few people have to make a commotion for noise to happen. But silence requires everyone to be in sync.
